definition: to or over a great extent or range, not on target
details:
adverb
- to or over a great extent or range
= synonyms: widely
- with or by a broad space
= example: with or by a broad space
- far from the intended target
= example: far from the intended target
= synonyms: astray
- to the fullest extent possible
= example: to the fullest extent possible
adjective
- not on target
= example: not on target
= synonyms: wide of the mark
- having ample fabric
= example: having ample fabric
= synonyms: full, wide-cut
- broad in scope or content
= synonyms: broad, across-the-board, all-embracing, all-encompassing, all-inclusive, blanket, encompassing, extensive, panoptic, encyclopedic, encyclopaedic
- very large in expanse or scope
= synonyms: broad, spacious
- (used of eyes) fully open or extended
= example: (used of eyes) fully open or extended
= synonyms: wide-eyed
- having great (or a certain) extent from one side to the other
= example: having great (or a certain) extent from one side to the other
= synonyms: broad
- great in degree
= example: great in degree
